bioghist.p: The Commission on Educational Policy was convened in 1966 by President Courtney Smith to study the educational principles and practices at Swarthmore College. The Commission studied Swarthmore's entire academic program, including curriculum, conditions of faculty scholarship, and college organization. Charles E. Gilbert was the Commission's chairman. The results of the Commission's study were published, along with reports by the Special Committee on Library Policy and the Special Committee on Student life, under the title Critique of a College in the fall of 1967.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Commission on Educational Policy from 1966 and 1967, with some documentation from earlier periods as well as reactions and follow-up from the report. Materials include: binders of minutes, correspondence, memoranda, and reports of the commission and its committees; interviews, questionnaires, and response papers from various constituencies, including students, faculty, alumni, and honors examiners; resource and reading materials from related efforts at other colleges and universities; and minutes from faculty discussion group meetings in response to the report and information on the implementation of the report's recommendations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
